name: South Park
overview: Follows the misadventures of four irreverent grade-schoolers in the quiet, dysfunctional town of South Park, Colorado.
cast: Trey Parker, Matt Stone
viewer_comments: An animated series that follows the adventures of four boys—Stan, Kyle, Cartman, and Kenny—in the fictional town of South Park, Colorado. Known for its crude humor, social commentary, and satire of various topics. It remains popular for its irreverent and boundary-pushing content.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA, suitable for mature audiences

name: Daughter from Another Mother
overview: After realizing their babies were exchanged at birth, two women develop a plan to adjust to their new lives: creating a single —and peculiar— family.
cast: Ludwika Paleta, Paulina Goto, Martín Altomaro, Liz Gallardo
viewer_comments: The series follows two very different mothers who discover that their babies were accidentally switched at birth, leading to an unconventional family arrangement. It is praised for its humorous take on modern family dynamics and strong performances by the lead actresses.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA in the US, suitable for mature audiences

name: Lady Voyeur
overview: A talented, voyeuristic hacker finds herself thrust into a dangerous investigation after her sex worker neighbor leaves for a weekend trip.
cast: Débora Nascimento, Emanuelle Araújo, Ângelo Rodrigues, Nikolas Antunes
viewer_comments: The series follows Miranda, an uncontrollable voyeur and skilled hacker, who gets entangled in a dangerous investigation after her sex worker neighbor leaves for a trip. The show is praised for its gripping narrative and strong performances.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA, suitable for mature audiences

name: The Vampire Diaries
overview: The story of two vampire brothers obsessed with the same girl, who bears a striking resemblance to the beautiful but ruthless vampire they knew and loved in 1864.
genre: Drama, Fantasy, Horror, Mystery, Romance, Thriller
cast: Nina Dobrev, Paul Wesley, Ian Somerhalder, Kat Graham, Candice King, Zach Roerig, Michael Trevino
viewer_comments: The series is set in the fictional town of Mystic Falls and follows Elena Gilbert as she becomes entangled in the world of vampires, witches, and other supernatural entities. It was praised for its engaging plot twists and character dynamics.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14 in the US, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: Young Sheldon
overview: The early life of child genius Sheldon Cooper, later seen in The Big Bang Theory.
cast: Iain Armitage, Zoe Perry, Lance Barber, Montana Jordan, Raegan Revord, Annie Potts
viewer_comments: A prequel to "The Big Bang Theory," the series follows young Sheldon Cooper as he grows up in East Texas. It is praised for its charming performances, especially by Iain Armitage, and its heartwarming depiction of family life.
target_ages_by_country: TV-PG, suitable for general audiences

name: Squid Game
overview: Hundreds of cash-strapped players accept a strange invitation to compete in children's games—with high stakes. But, a tempting prize awaits the victor.
cast: Lee Jung-jae, Park Hae-soo, Wi Ha-joon, Jung Ho-yeon
viewer_comments: The series centers on a group of individuals participating in deadly children's games for a massive cash prize. It has received critical acclaim for its compelling narrative, social commentary, and intense action scenes.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA in the US, suitable for mature audiences

name: Peaky Blinders
overview: A gangster family epic set in 1919 Birmingham, England and centered on a gang who sew razor blades in the peaks of their caps, and their fierce boss Tommy Shelby, who means to move up in the world.
cast: Cillian Murphy, Paul Anderson, Helen McCrory, Sophie Rundle, Sam Neill, Annabelle Wallis, Tom Hardy
viewer_comments: The show received widespread acclaim for its writing, acting, visual style, and depiction of historical events.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA in the US, suitable for mature audiences

name: All of Us Are Dead
overview: A high school becomes ground zero for a zombie virus outbreak. Trapped students must fight their way out — or turn into one of the rabid infected.
cast: Yoon Chan-young, Park Ji-hoo, Cho Yi-hyun, Lomon
viewer_comments: The series follows a group of high school students trapped in their school during a zombie outbreak. It is praised for its intense action, character development, and commentary on social issues.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA, suitable for mature audiences

name: Halo
overview: Depicting an epic 26th-century conflict between humanity and an alien threat known as the Covenant, the series weaves deeply drawn personal stories with action, adventure and a richly imagined vision of the future.
cast: Pablo Schreiber, Natascha McElhone, Yerin Ha
viewer_comments: Based on the popular video game franchise, "Halo" follows the epic conflict between humanity and an alien threat known as the Covenant. The series has been praised for its visual effects and action sequences, staying true to the lore of the games while expanding on the universe.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA, suitable for mature audiences

name: Game of Thrones
overview: Seven noble families fight for control of the mythical land of Westeros. Friction between the houses leads to full-scale war. All while a very ancient evil awakens in the farthest north. Amidst the war, a neglected military order of misfits, the Night's Watch, is all that stands between the realms of men and icy horrors beyond.
cast: Emilia Clarke, Kit Harington, Peter Dinklage, Lena Headey, Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Sophie Turner, Maisie Williams
viewer_comments: The series was highly praised for its complex characters, storytelling, and production values, although its final season received mixed reviews.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA in the US, suitable for mature audiences

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power
overview: Beginning in a time of relative peace, we follow an ensemble cast of characters as they confront the re-emergence of evil to Middle-earth. From the darkest depths of the Misty Mountains, to the majestic forests of Lindon, to the breathtaking island kingdom of Númenor, to the furthest reaches of the map, these kingdoms and characters will carve out legacies that live on long after they are gone.
cast: Morfydd Clark, Robert Aramayo, Markella Kavenagh, Benjamin Walker, Ismael Cruz Córdova, Nazanin Boniadi
viewer_comments: Set in the Second Age of Middle-earth, thousands of years before the events of J.R.R. Tolkien's "The Hobbit" and "The Lord of the Rings," the series covers the forging of the Rings of Power, the rise of the Dark Lord Sauron, and the epic tale of Númenor. It has been praised for its high production values, visual effects, and expansive storytelling that delves deeper into Tolkien's lore.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14 in the US, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: The Addams Family
overview: A satirical inversion of the ideal of the perfect American nuclear family, they are an eccentric wealthy family who delight in everything grotesque and macabre, and are never really aware that people find them bizarre or frightening. In fact, they themselves are often terrified by "normal" people.
cast: Carolyn Jones, John Astin, Jackie Coogan, Ted Cassidy, Lisa Loring
viewer_comments: The show follows the misadventures of a blissfully macabre but extremely loving family. It's praised for its humor, unique characters, and its satirical take on the ideal American family.
target_ages_by_country: TV-G in the US, suitable for general audiences

name: Blue Bloods
overview: A drama about a multi-generational family of cops dedicated to New York City law enforcement. Frank Reagan is the New York Police Commissioner and heads both the police force and the Reagan brood. He runs his department as diplomatically as he runs his family, even when dealing with the politics that plagued his unapologetically bold father, Henry, during his stint as Chief.
cast: Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes, Len Cariou
viewer_comments: The series centers on the Reagan family, an Irish-American Catholic family with a history of work in law enforcement. It is praised for its portrayal of family dynamics, strong character development, and the blend of procedural and personal drama.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14 in the US, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: Perry Mason
overview: The cases of master criminal defense attorney Perry Mason and his staff who handled the most difficult of cases in the aid of the innocent.
cast: Raymond Burr, Barbara Hale, William Hopper, Ray Collins, William Talman
viewer_comments: The series follows Perry Mason, a criminal defense lawyer who handles the most difficult cases. It is praised for its compelling courtroom drama and Raymond Burr's iconic performance as Perry Mason.
target_ages_by_country: TV-PG in the US, suitable for general audiences

name: House of Cards
overview: Set in present day Washington, D.C., House of Cards is the story of Frank Underwood, a ruthless and cunning politician, and his wife Claire who will stop at nothing to conquer everything. This wicked political drama penetrates the shadowy world of greed, sex and corruption in modern D.C.
cast: Kevin Spacey, Robin Wright, Michael Kelly, Kate Mara, Corey Stoll
viewer_comments: The series follows Frank Underwood, a ruthless politician, and his equally ambitious wife Claire as they navigate the treacherous political landscape to gain and maintain power. Praised for its writing, performances, and dark portrayal of politics.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA in the US, suitable for mature audiences

name: Outlander
overview: The story of Claire Randall, a married combat nurse from 1945 who is mysteriously swept back in time to 1743, where she is immediately thrown into an unknown world where her life is threatened. When she is forced to marry Jamie, a chivalrous and romantic young Scottish warrior, a passionate affair is ignited that tears Claire's heart between two vastly different men in two irreconcilable lives.
cast: Caitríona Balfe, Sam Heughan, Tobias Menzies, Duncan Lacroix, Sophie Skelton
viewer_comments: The series follows Claire Randall, a former WWII nurse who is transported back to 1743. She marries a Highland warrior and becomes embroiled in a rebellion. Praised for its epic storytelling, strong performances, and historical detail.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA in the US, suitable for mature audiences

name: Mom
overview: Aan irreverent and outrageous take on true family love‐and dysfunction. Newly sober single mom Christy struggles to raise two children in a world full of temptations and pitfalls. Testing her sobriety is her formerly estranged mother, now back in Christy's life and eager to share passive-aggressive insights into her daughter's many mistakes.
cast: Anna Faris, Allison Janney, Mimi Kennedy, Jaime Pressly, Beth Hall
viewer_comments: The series follows Christy, a single mother, who reunites with her estranged mother to navigate sobriety and life. Praised for its blend of comedy and emotional depth, and Allison Janney's performance.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14 in the US, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: Guillermo del Toro's Cabinet of Curiosities
overview: Bizarre nightmares unfold in eight tales of terror in this visually stunning, spine-tingling horror collection curated by Guillermo del Toro.
cast: Ben Barnes, Elpidia Carrillo, Demetrius Grosse, Crispin Glover
viewer_comments: This anthology series features eight unique horror stories curated by Guillermo del Toro. Each episode offers a different tale of horror, showcasing a blend of supernatural and psychological elements. It is noted for its high production values and chilling narratives.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA in the US, suitable for mature audiences

name: Dark Desire
overview: Married Alma spends a fateful weekend away from home that ignites passion, ends in tragedy and leads her to question the truth about those close to her.
cast: Maite Perroni, Erik Hayser, Alejandro Speitzer, Regina Pavón, Jorge Poza
viewer_comments: The series revolves around Alma, a married woman who spends a fateful weekend away from home that ignites passion, ends in tragedy, and leads her to question the truth about those close to her. Praised for its suspenseful plot and steamy scenes.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA in the US, suitable for mature audiences

name: The Boys
overview: A group of vigilantes known informally as “The Boys” set out to take down corrupt superheroes with no more than blue-collar grit and a willingness to fight dirty.
cast: Karl Urban, Jack Quaid, Antony Starr, Erin Moriarty
viewer_comments: The Boys is a satirical superhero series that follows a group of vigilantes as they combat superpowered individuals known as "Supes," who abuse their powers. The series is known for its dark humor, intense action scenes, and social commentary.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA, suitable for mature audiences

name: The Orville
overview: Follow the crew of the not-so-functional exploratory ship in the Earth's interstellar fleet, 400 years in the future.
cast: Seth MacFarlane, Adrianne Palicki, Penny Johnson Jerald, Scott Grimes, Peter Macon
viewer_comments: Set 400 years in the future, the crew of the U.S.S. Orville continues their mission of exploration, navigating both the mysteries of the universe and the complexities of their own interpersonal relationships. The show is praised for its humor, homage to classic sci-fi, and character development.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14 in the US, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: Chicago Fire
overview: An edge-of-your-seat view into the lives of everyday heroes committed to one of America's noblest professions. For the firefighters, rescue squad and paramedics of Chicago Firehouse 51, no occupation is more stressful or dangerous, yet so rewarding and exhilarating. These courageous men and women are among the elite who forge headfirst into danger when everyone else is running the other way and whose actions make the difference between life and death.
cast: Taylor Kinney, Christian Stolte, Eamonn Walker, Joe Minoso
viewer_comments: Chicago Fire follows the professional and personal lives of firefighters, rescue personnel, and paramedics of the Chicago Fire Department. The show is known for its intense action scenes and compelling character development.

name: Stranger Things
overview: When a young boy vanishes, a small town uncovers a mystery involving secret experiments, terrifying supernatural forces, and one strange little girl.
genre: Drama, Fantasy, Horror, Mystery, Sci-Fi, Thriller
cast: Winona Ryder, David Harbour, Finn Wolfhard, Millie Bobby Brown, Gaten Matarazzo, Caleb McLaughlin, Natalia Dyer
viewer_comments: The series is set in the 1980s and focuses on the investigation of a young boy's disappearance, unveiling a series of supernatural events involving a girl with psychokinetic abilities. It has been praised for its nostalgic references, acting, and suspenseful storytelling.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14 in the US, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: Bones
overview: Dr. Temperance Brennan and her colleagues at the Jeffersonian's Medico-Legal Lab assist Special Agent Seeley Booth with murder investigations when the remains are so badly decomposed, burned or destroyed that the standard identification methods are useless.

viewer_comments: The series follows forensic anthropologist Dr. Temperance "Bones" Brennan and FBI Special Agent Seeley Booth as they solve crimes by examining human remains. Known for its unique premise, character chemistry, and blend of drama and humor.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: Criminal Minds
overview: An elite team of FBI profilers analyze the country's most twisted criminal minds, anticipating their next moves before they strike again. The Behavioral Analysis Unit's most experienced agent is David Rossi, a founding member of the BAU who returns to help the team solve new cases.
cast: Joe Mantegna, Matthew Gray Gubler, A.J. Cook, Kirsten Vangsness, Shemar Moore, Paget Brewster, Thomas Gibson, Mandy Patinkin
viewer_comments: The show follows a team of FBI profilers in the Behavioral Analysis Unit (BAU) as they use behavioral analysis to track down and apprehend serial killers and other dangerous criminals. It has been praised for its intriguing and often chilling storylines, as well as the chemistry and depth of its main characters. The series has developed a strong fan base and spawned several spin-offs and adaptations.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14 in the US, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: Euphoria
overview: A group of high school students navigate love and friendships in a world of drugs, sex, trauma, and social media.
cast: Zendaya, Hunter Schafer, Jacob Elordi, Alexa Demie
viewer_comments: The series explores the lives of high school students navigating drugs, sex, identity, trauma, social media, love, and friendship. Praised for its raw portrayal of teenage struggles and Zendaya's standout performance.

name: She-Hulk: Attorney at Law
overview: Jennifer Walters navigates the complicated life of a single, 30-something attorney who also happens to be a green 6-foot-7-inch superpowered hulk.
cast: Tatiana Maslany, Mark Ruffalo, Tim Roth, Benedict Wong, Ginger Gonzaga, Josh Segarra
viewer_comments: She-Hulk follows Jennifer Walters, an attorney specializing in superhuman-oriented legal cases, who navigates life as a single, 30-something woman while also transforming into the superpowered She-Hulk after an accident involving her cousin Bruce Banner. The series is known for its humor, action, and unique take on the superhero genre.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: Gypsy
overview: The journey of Jean Holloway – a therapist who begins to develop dangerous and intimate relationships with the people in her patients' lives.
cast: Naomi Watts, Billy Crudup, Sophie Cookson, Karl Glusman, Lucy Boynton
viewer_comments: The series follows a therapist who develops dangerous and intimate relationships with people in her patients' lives. Praised for its suspense and Naomi Watts' performance, but criticized for its slow pace.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA in the US, suitable for mature audiences

name: The Mentalist
overview: Patrick Jane, a former celebrity psychic medium, uses his razor sharp skills of observation and expertise at "reading" people to solve serious crimes with the California Bureau of Investigation.
cast: Simon Baker, Robin Tunney, Tim Kang, Owain Yeoman
viewer_comments: The series centers on Patrick Jane, a former psychic medium who becomes a consultant for the California Bureau of Investigation (CBI), using his keen observational skills to solve crimes. It is lauded for Simon Baker's charismatic performance and the show's blend of procedural and psychological elements.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: Marvel's The Punisher
overview: A former Marine out to punish the criminals responsible for his family's murder finds himself ensnared in a military conspiracy.
cast: Jon Bernthal, Ben Barnes, Ebon Moss-Bachrach, Deborah Ann Woll, Amber Rose Revah
viewer_comments: The series follows Frank Castle, a former Marine turned vigilante known as The Punisher, who seeks to avenge the deaths of his family while uncovering a larger conspiracy. Praised for its intense action scenes and Jon Bernthal's performance.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA in the US, suitable for mature audiences

name: The Simpsons
overview: Set in Springfield, the average American town, the show focuses on the antics and everyday adventures of the Simpson family; Homer, Marge, Bart, Lisa and Maggie, as well as a virtual cast of thousands. Since the beginning, the series has been a pop culture icon, attracting hundreds of celebrities to guest star. The show has also made name for itself in its fearless satirical take on politics, media and American life in general.
cast: Dan Castellaneta, Julie Kavner, Nancy Cartwright, Yeardley Smith, Harry Shearer, Hank Azaria
viewer_comments: The show is a satirical depiction of a dysfunctional middle-class American lifestyle, represented by the Simpson family in the fictional town of Springfield. It is celebrated for its satirical humor, cultural references, and memorable characters.
target_ages_by_country: TV-PG in the US, suitable for general viewing with parental guidance suggested

name: Breaking Bad
overview: When Walter White, a New Mexico chemistry teacher, is diagnosed with Stage III cancer and given a prognosis of only two years left to live. He becomes filled with a sense of fearlessness and an unrelenting desire to secure his family's financial future at any cost as he enters the dangerous world of drugs and crime.
cast: Bryan Cranston, Aaron Paul, Anna Gunn, Dean Norris, Betsy Brandt, RJ Mitte, Bob Odenkirk
viewer_comments: The show follows a high school chemistry teacher turned methamphetamine manufacturer, exploring themes of moral consequence and survival. It received critical acclaim for its writing, acting, and character development, particularly for Bryan Cranston's and Aaron Paul's performances.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA in the US, suitable for mature audiences

name: Friends
overview: Six young people from New York City, on their own and struggling to survive in the real world, find the companionship, comfort and support they get from each other to be the perfect antidote to the pressures of life.
cast: Jennifer Aniston, Courteney Cox, Lisa Kudrow, Matt LeBlanc, Matthew Perry, David Schwimmer
viewer_comments: The series revolves around six friends living in New York City, dealing with personal and professional challenges. Known for its humor, memorable characters, and lasting cultural impact.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: Pasapalabra
cast: Christian Gálvez (Spain), Roberto Leal (Spain), Marco Antonio Regil (Mexico)
viewer_comments: The show involves contestants answering word-based puzzles and questions to win prizes. It is popular for its engaging format, intellectual challenge, and family-friendly content.

name: Prison Break
overview: Due to a political conspiracy, an innocent man is sent to death row and his only hope is his brother, who makes it his mission to deliberately get himself sent to the same prison in order to break the both of them out, from the inside out.
cast: Wentworth Miller, Dominic Purcell, Sarah Wayne Callies, Amaury Nolasco, Robert Knepper
viewer_comments: The series revolves around Michael Scofield, who devises an elaborate plan to help his wrongfully convicted brother escape from prison. It is praised for its suspenseful plot, clever writing, and strong performances.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14 in the US, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: House of the Dragon
overview: The Targaryen rule is at its peak, controlling over 15 dragons. Most empires crumble from such heights. In the case of the Targaryens, their slow fall begins when King Viserys breaks with a century of tradition by naming his daughter Rhaenyra heir to the Iron Throne. But when Viserys later fathers a son, the court is shocked when Rhaenyra retains her status as his heir, and seeds of division sow friction across the realm.
cast: Paddy Considine, Matt Smith, Emma D'Arcy, Olivia Cooke, Rhys Ifans
viewer_comments: Taking place in the same universe as "Game of Thrones," the series explores the history of House Targaryen and the events leading up to the Targaryen civil war known as the Dance of the Dragons. It has been praised for its high production values, complex characters, and intricate political drama.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA in the US, suitable for mature audiences

name: BLUELOCK
overview: After a disastrous defeat at the 2018 World Cup, Japan's team struggles to regroup. But what's missing? An absolute Ace Striker, who can guide them to the win. The Japan Football Union is hell-bent on creating a striker who hungers for goals and thirsts for victory, and who can be the decisive instrument in turning around a losing match...and to do so, they've gathered 300 of Japan's best and brightest youth players. Who will emerge to lead the team...and will they be able to out-muscle and out-ego everyone who stands in their way?
cast: Tasuku Kaito, Kazuki Ura, Yuki Ono
viewer_comments: An intense sports anime that revolves around a young soccer player who enters a rigorous and competitive training program to become the best striker in the world. The series is noted for its high-energy animation, thrilling matches, and character development.
target_ages_by_country: PG-13, suitable for teens and older

name: Bleach
overview: For as long as he can remember, Ichigo Kurosaki has been able to see ghosts. But when he meets Rukia, a Soul Reaper who battles evil spirits known as Hollows, he finds his life is changed forever. Now, with a newfound wealth of spiritual energy, Ichigo discovers his true calling: to protect the living and the dead from evil.
cast: Masakazu Morita, Fumiko Orikasa, Rie Kugimiya, Hiroki Yasumoto
viewer_comments: The series follows Ichigo Kurosaki, a high school student who becomes a Soul Reaper and battles evil spirits known as Hollows. It is known for its engaging storyline, dynamic characters, and intense battles.
target_ages_by_country: TV-PG, suitable for general audiences

name: The Witcher
overview: Geralt of Rivia, a mutated monster-hunter for hire, journeys toward his destiny in a turbulent world where people often prove more wicked than beasts.
cast: Henry Cavill, Anya Chalotra, Freya Allan, Joey Batey, MyAnna Buring
viewer_comments: Based on the book series by Andrzej Sapkowski, the show follows Geralt of Rivia, a monster hunter, as he navigates a world filled with dangerous creatures and political intrigue. It has been praised for its production values, action sequences, and Cavill's performance.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA in the US, suitable for mature audiences

name: 28 Days Haunted
overview: Three teams each spend 28 days in some of America's most haunted locations for a paranormal experiment based on the theories of Ed and Lorraine Warren.
cast: Josh Goodman, Tony Spera, Sean Austin, Jereme Leonard
viewer_comments: Three teams spend 28 days in some of the most haunted locations in the United States for an experiment based on the theories of Ed and Lorraine Warren. The show combines elements of reality TV with horror.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14 in the US, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: Family Guy
overview: Sick, twisted, politically incorrect and Freakin' Sweet animated series featuring the adventures of the dysfunctional Griffin family. Bumbling Peter and long-suffering Lois have three kids. Stewie (a brilliant but sadistic baby bent on killing his mother and taking over the world), Meg (the oldest, and is the most unpopular girl in town) and Chris (the middle kid, he's not very bright but has a passion for movies). The final member of the family is Brian - a talking dog and much more than a pet, he keeps Stewie in check whilst sipping Martinis and sorting through his own life issues.
cast: Seth MacFarlane, Alex Borstein, Mila Kunis, Seth Green
viewer_comments: The show follows the dysfunctional Griffin family in the fictional town of Quahog, Rhode Island. Known for its cutaway gags, cultural references, and satirical humor. It has built a loyal fanbase over the years.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: Something Just Like This
overview: Qian Xi Xi grew up living with Duan Ran, a second-generation heir of a rich family. The two childhood sweethearts are inseparable even after they enter the work force as e-commerce entrepreneurs. They experience ups and downs, obstacles and complications that are beyond what they had imagined. But throughout the process, they made friends with people who share similar ambitions and together, they carve out their own path. Follow their journey of discovering true love and fulfilling their dreams.
cast: Johnny Bai, Deng Jiajia, Li Qiang, Yang Kun, Gao Lu
viewer_comments: The series follows a group of young individuals navigating their careers and personal lives in the city. It is known for its relatable storylines and strong performances.

name: His Dark Materials
overview: Lyra is an orphan who lives in a parallel universe in which science, theology, and magic are intertwined. Her search for a kidnapped friend uncovers a sinister plot involving stolen children and turns into a quest to understand a mysterious phenomenon called Dust. She is later joined on her journey by Will, a boy who possesses a knife that can cut windows between worlds. As she learns the truth about her parents and her prophesied destiny, the two young people are caught up in a war against celestial powers that ranges across many worlds.
cast: Dafne Keen, Kit Connor, Ruth Wilson, Amir Wilson
viewer_comments: Based on Philip Pullman's trilogy of novels, the series follows young orphan Lyra as she embarks on a journey to uncover a sinister plot involving stolen children and a mysterious substance known as Dust. The series is praised for its visual splendor, strong performances, and faithful adaptation of the source material.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: The Good Doctor
overview: Shaun Murphy, a young surgeon with autism and savant syndrome, relocates from a quiet country life to join a prestigious hospital's surgical unit. Unable to personally connect with those around him, Shaun uses his extraordinary medical gifts to save lives and challenge the skepticism of his colleagues.
cast: Freddie Highmore, Antonia Thomas, Nicholas Gonzalez, Hill Harper, Richard Schiff, Christina Chang, Paige Spara
viewer_comments: The series follows Shaun Murphy, a young autistic surgeon with savant syndrome, from Casper, Wyoming, who relocates to San Jose, California, to work at the prestigious San Jose St. Bonaventure Hospital. The show has received mixed reviews, with praise for Highmore's performance but criticism for its portrayal of autism.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14 in the US, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: Supernatural
overview: When they were boys, Sam and Dean Winchester lost their mother to a mysterious and demonic supernatural force. Subsequently, their father raised them to be soldiers. He taught them about the paranormal evil that lives in the dark corners and on the back roads of America ... and he taught them how to kill it. Now, the Winchester brothers crisscross the country in their '67 Chevy Impala, battling every kind of supernatural threat they encounter along the way.
cast: Jared Padalecki, Jensen Ackles, Misha Collins, Mark Sheppard, Alexander Calvert
viewer_comments: The series follows brothers Sam and Dean Winchester as they hunt demons, ghosts, monsters, and other supernatural beings. The show is praised for its strong lead performances, engaging storytelling, and the chemistry between the two main actors. It has a dedicated fan base and has been praised for its longevity and ability to reinvent itself over the years.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14 in the US, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: Tamron Hall
overview: Former news host and journalist Tamron Hall discusses all things topical and engages those she interviews in thorough meaningful and entertaining conversations.
cast: Tamron Hall
viewer_comments: Tamron Hall hosts in-depth and relatable conversations covering a variety of topics. The show is praised for its engaging and inspirational content.
target_ages_by_country: TV-PG in the US, suitable for general audiences

name: The Walking Dead
overview: Rick Grimes, a sheriff's deputy, wakes up from a coma to discover a world overrun by zombies. His journey to find his family brings him face to face with other survivors.
cast: Andrew Lincoln, Norman Reedus, Melissa McBride, Lauren Cohan, Danai Gurira, Jeffrey Dean Morgan
viewer_comments: The series follows a group of survivors navigating a world overrun by zombies, known as "walkers." The show is known for its intense, character-driven storytelling and its exploration of the human condition in a post-apocalyptic setting. It became a cultural phenomenon and maintained high viewership, especially in its earlier seasons.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA in the US, suitable for mature audiences

name: Dragon Ball Z
overview: After learning that he is from another planet, a warrior named Goku and his friends are prompted to defend it from an onslaught of extraterrestrial enemies.
genre: Action, Adventure, Fantasy, Martial Arts, Shounen
cast: Masako Nozawa, Ryo Horikawa, Sean Schemmel, Christopher Sabat
viewer_comments: Dragon Ball Z follows the adventures of Goku who, along with his companions, defends the Earth against an assortment of villains ranging from intergalactic space fighters to nearly indestructible creatures. The series is known for its epic battles, intense action sequences, and memorable characters.
target_ages_by_country: TV-PG, suitable for general audiences

name: Oggy and the Cockroaches
overview: Oggy, an anthropomorphic cat, would prefer to spend his days watching television and eating, but is continuously pestered by three roaches: Joey, Marky and Dee Dee. The cockroaches' slapstick mischief ranges from plundering Oggy's refrigerator to hijacking the train he just boarded. In many situations Oggy is also helped by Jack, who is more violent and short-tempered than him and is also annoyed by the cockroaches. Bob, a short-tempered bulldog, also appears in the show, and is Oggy's neighbor.
cast: Hugues Le Bars, Michel Elias, Santi Ugarte
viewer_comments: The series follows the misadventures of a cat named Oggy and his constant battle with three troublesome cockroaches. Known for its slapstick humor and minimal dialogue, it is a hit among children.
target_ages_by_country: TV-Y7, suitable for children aged 7 and older

name: Skins
overview: Irreverent comedy drama which follows the messy lives, loves, delirious highs and inevitable lows of a group of raucous teenage friends in Bristol.
cast: Nicholas Hoult, Kaya Scodelario, Hannah Murray, Jack O'Connell, Dev Patel
viewer_comments: The series follows a group of teenagers in Bristol as they navigate complex issues such as substance abuse, mental illness, and sexuality. Known for its raw and realistic portrayal of adolescence.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA in the US, suitable for mature audiences

name: Lucifer
overview: Bored and unhappy as the Lord of Hell, Lucifer Morningstar abandoned his throne and retired to Los Angeles, where he has teamed up with LAPD detective Chloe Decker to take down criminals. But the longer he's away from the underworld, the greater the threat that the worst of humanity could escape.
cast: Tom Ellis, Lauren German, Kevin Alejandro, D.B. Woodside, Lesley-Ann Brandt
viewer_comments: The series follows Lucifer Morningstar, the Devil, who abandons Hell to run a nightclub in Los Angeles and becomes a consultant to the LAPD. It combines elements of crime procedural with supernatural themes and is known for Tom Ellis's charismatic performance and its humorous take on the character of Lucifer.
target_ages_by_country: TV-14 in the US, suitable for viewers 14 and older

name: Echo 3
overview: When brilliant scientist Amber Chesborough vanishes along the Colombia-Venezuela border, her brother and her husband—both elite U.S. Army commandos—struggle to find her amid a guerilla war, discovering that the woman they love might have a secret.
cast: Michiel Huisman, Luke Evans, Jessica Ann Collins
viewer_comments: This series follows the rescue mission of a woman kidnapped in South America, with her brother and husband, both military operatives, leading the charge. Praised for its intense action sequences and gripping storyline.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA, suitable for mature audiences

name: You
overview: A dangerously charming, intensely obsessive young man goes to extreme measures to insert himself into the lives of those he is transfixed by.
cast: Penn Badgley, Elizabeth Lail, Victoria Pedretti, Ambyr Childers, Shay Mitchell
viewer_comments: The series follows Joe Goldberg, a charming but dangerously obsessive young man who goes to extreme measures to insert himself into the lives of those he is transfixed by. It is praised for its gripping plot, character development, and Penn Badgley's performance.
target_ages_by_country: TV-MA in the US, suitable for mature audiences
